welcome.title: Welcome to Pattern Projector!
welcome.description: Pattern projector is a free and open source web app that helps users quickly calibrate projectors for sewing patterns. This project is currently in beta, so expect large changes and new features to be added as we iterate.

requirements.title: What You’ll Need
requirements.mat: Cutting mat: ideally with grid lines at every inch or centimeter
requirements.mount: Tripod or wall/shelf/table mount for projector
requirements.computer: Computer or tablet to connect to the projector
requirements.pattern: A PDF sewing pattern: consider using <pdfstitcher>PDFStitcher</pdfstitcher> if your pattern has layers or multiple pages

setup.title: Setup
setup.place: Place the projector above the cutting mat, pointing at the cutting mat. Try to place the projector directly above the cutting mat and pointing directly at it.
setup.connect: Connect your computer or tablet to the projector and either mirror or extend the display so that image from computer or tablet is shown on the projector.
setup.focus: Adjust the focus on the projector, until text is crisp in the centre of the projection. If you cannot get a clear image, ensure the distance between the projector and cutting mat is within the functional range recommended by the manufacturer.
setup.keystone: If your projector has a keystone, adjust it so that projection is close to rectangular and focus near the edges improves.

calibration.title: Calibration
calibration.input: Input the width and height of your mat.
calibration.fullscreen: Enter full screen mode by clicking (or tapping)
calibration.drag: Drag the corners of the grid to align with your mat. With your eyes on the mat, adjust the corners on your computer or tablet. Adjust the placement of the corners until the projected grid matches your mat's grid.
calibration.project: When the projected grid is aligned with your mat, click (or tap) “Project.”

project.title: Projecting a Pattern
project.open: Click (or tap) <pdficon></pdficon> to open the PDF document.
project.move: Move the PDF by clicking and dragging it around the screen.
project.tools: In projection mode there are several tools provided:

showGrid.title: Show/hide grid
showGrid.description: When projecting, it shows/hides a faint grid to verify that your calibration is correct.

invert.title: Invert Colors
invert.description: When projecting, it's usually easier to see white lines on black.

flip.title: Flip Vertical/Horizontal
flip.description: Helpful when mirroring patterns in half.

rotate.title: Rotate
rotate.description: Change the orientation of the pattern by 90 degrees.

fullscreen.title: Full screen
fullscreen.description: It's generally easier to use the software in full screen mode.

gridSize.question: Having trouble dragging the grid corners to the edge of your mat?
gridSize.answer: You don't have to calibrate using your entire mat, instead choose the largest area you can fit the calibration grid in and make sure your width and height inputs match the width and height of the grid.

wrongSizePdf.question: Is your PDF projecting too small or large?
wrongSizePdf.answer: The Pattern Projector calibration tool has no zoom because the scale of the projection comes from the size information in the PDF. Patterns from designers usually have the correct scale, so a change in scale could have been introduced when opening the pattern in Affinity Designer or Inkscape.

saveAsApp.question: Do you want to save Pattern Projector as an app?
saveAsApp.answer: Pattern Projector is a Progressive Web App (PWA) so it can be saved as an app. On a Desktop, you can install it using <googleChromeLink>Chrome</googleChromeLink> or <microsoftEdgeLink>Edge</microsoftEdgeLink>. On a tablet, open the Share menu and tap Add to Home Screen.

annotationSupport.question: Do you have support for adding annotations?
annotationSupport.answer: Not yet, but it's planned for an upcoming release.

chromecastSupport.question: Do you support Chromecast?
chromecastSupport.answer: While it's possible to cast this webpage in Chrome, the lag in the connection can be frustrating, especially when calibrating. Better support for Chromecast is planned in an upcoming release.

mobileSupport.question: Do you have support mobile phones and tablets?
mobileSupport.answer: While possible to visit and use the webpage on a smart phone, the limited screen size makes it difficult to use. Better mobile support is planned in an upcoming release.
